Introduction to {altcheckr} functions

Matt Dray

2020-08-23

Source: vignettes/introduction.Rmd
introduction.Rmd

Install

You can install {altcheckr} from GitHub using the {remotes} package.

install.packages(remotes)
install_github("matt-dray/altcheckr")
library(altcheckr)

Get image elements

Use the alt_get() function to scrape the attributes of each element on a web page that you name in the url argument,

The function uses {xml2} and {rvest} to scrape a given web page and extract image attributes, with a little bit of {purrr} to get it into a data frame.

get_img <- alt_get("https://www.bbc.co.uk/news")

The function returns a tibble where each row is an image element from that page and columns are the the image source (src), alt text (alt) and link to a file with a longer description (longdesc), if it exists (sometimes used for complex images). The alt column will be created and filled with NA if it isn’t present.

Setting the argument all_attributes to TRUE will return all the attributes provided in the element, not just src, alt and longdesc.

Here is a preview of the tibble that is output from alt_get():

print(get_img)
#> # A tibble: 54 x 2
#>    src                                    alt                                   
#>    <chr>                                  <chr>                                 
#>  1 https://a1.api.bbc.co.uk/hit.xiti?&co… ""                                    
#>  2 https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/news/null/cp… "US Postal Service worker pushes a ma…
#>  3 data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIA… "Belarussian President Alexander Luka…
#>  4 data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIA… "School pupils socially distance"     
#>  5 data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIA… "Chinese-owned TikTok video app has a…
#>  6 data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIA… "Fire-fighters are working 72-hour sh…
#>  7 data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIA… "Emergency staff outside the club in …
#>  8 data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIA… "Crowds of young people"              
#>  9 data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIA… "Flowers in Christchurch after the sh…
#> 10 data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIA… "File picture of Miroslava Breach"    
#> # … with 44 more rows

Check alt text

You can then pass the output of alt_get() to alt_check() to perform a series of basic assessments of each image’s alt text.

(You can also pass any data frame that contains a src and alt column, where alt contains the text to be assessed by alt_check(). For example, {altcheckr} has a built-in dataset: example_get.)

check_img <- alt_check(get_img)

This will return the same tibble as alt_get(), but new columns have now been appended.

Each new column is the outcome of a check for a possible accessibility issue with the alt text. For example, whether the alt text actually exists and whether it is long.

print(check_img)
#> # A tibble: 54 x 10
#>    src   alt   alt_exists nchar_count nchar_assess file_ext self_evident
#>    <chr> <chr> <chr>            <int> <chr>        <lgl>    <lgl>       
#>  1 http… ""    Empty               NA <NA>         NA       NA          
#>  2 http… "US … Exists             104 OK           FALSE    FALSE       
#>  3 data… "Bel… Exists              84 OK           FALSE    FALSE       
#>  4 data… "Sch… Exists              31 OK           FALSE    FALSE       
#>  5 data… "Chi… Exists              69 OK           FALSE    FALSE       
#>  6 data… "Fir… Exists              86 OK           FALSE    FALSE       
#>  7 data… "Eme… Exists              40 OK           FALSE    FALSE       
#>  8 data… "Cro… Exists              22 OK           FALSE    FALSE       
#>  9 data… "Flo… Exists              56 OK           FALSE    FALSE       
#> 10 data… "Fil… Exists              32 OK           FALSE    TRUE        
#> # … with 44 more rows, and 3 more variables: terminal_punct <lgl>,
#> #   spellcheck <list>, not_basic <list>

And here is the structure now:

dplyr::glimpse(check_img)
#> Rows: 54
#> Columns: 10
#> $ src            <chr> "https://a1.api.bbc.co.uk/hit.xiti?&col=1&from=p&ptag=…
#> $ alt            <chr> "", "US Postal Service worker pushes a mail bin outsid…
#> $ alt_exists     <chr> "Empty", "Exists", "Exists", "Exists", "Exists", "Exis…
#> $ nchar_count    <int> NA, 104, 84, 31, 69, 86, 40, 22, 56, 32, 127, 32, 127,…
#> $ nchar_assess   <chr> NA, "OK", "OK", "OK", "OK", "OK", "OK", "OK", "OK", "O…
#> $ file_ext       <lgl> NA, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, F…
#> $ self_evident   <lgl> NA, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, F…
#> $ terminal_punct <lgl> NA, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, F…
#> $ spellcheck     <list> [<>, <>, <"Belarussian", "Lukashenko", "Grodno">, <>,…
#> $ not_basic      <list> [<>, <"us", "postal", "service", "worker", "pushes", …
